refsection.para: If chunk-navparamchunk-nav is true, keyboard navigation will be added to chunked output. This is accomplished by adding the chunk-nav-jsparamchunk-nav-js script to the generated HTML.
In addition, if the speaker notes extension is used, S will toggle between the normal view and the speaker notes view.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If chunk navigation is enabled, this script is added to each chunk to support keyboard navigation.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter identifies the output directory where “chunks” will be stored. If the stylesheet is not producing chunked results (see ), this parameter has no effect.
If the ext:cwd extension function (see ) is available, its value will be the default value for this parameter. If the extension isn’t available, you must provide a value for this parameter.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this parameter is true, footnotes will be renumbered within chunks. See v:chunk-renumber-footnotesvariablev:chunk-renumber-footnotes.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the chunking depth for recursive sections

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter is only relevant when chunking is being performed, see . For recursive sections (section, and refsection), if the section would be a chunk according to chunk-includeparamchunk-include, it is further tested against chunk-section-depthparamchunk-section-depth. If it is nested more deeply than chunk-section-depthparamchunk-section-depth, it will not be considered for chunking.

note.para: In principle, this parameter is unnecessary as it could be represented by chunk-excludeparamchunk-exclude expressions. However, changing the section depth is a common customization, so it’s handled as a separate parameter.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Elements inside a class synopsis (field and method declarations, for example) will be indented by this amount.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Include component labels in section labels?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If true, section labels will be prefixed with the label of their containing component (chapter, appendix, etc.) In other words, the first section of chapter 2 will be labeled “2.1” if this is true and simply “1” if it’s false.
See also division-numbers-inheritparamdivision-numbers-inherit, section-numbers-inheritparamsection-numbers-inherit, and v:title-propertiesvariablev:title-properties.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the theme-pickerparamtheme-picker is enabled, a link to this script will be added to the document. This script must contain the JavaScript necessary to support the theme controls.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Collapse sequential copyright years into a range?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If true, sequential copyright years will be collapsed into a range.
For example,
might be rendered: “Copyright © 1993, 1997–1999 Jane Smith”.
If copyright-collapse-yearsvariablecopyright-collapse-years is false, that wold be rendered: “Copyright © 1993, 1997, 1998, 1999 Jane Smith”.
See also copyright-year-range-separatorvariablecopyright-year-range-separator and copyright-year-separatorvariablecopyright-year-separator.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Separator character for copyright year ranges

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When a sequence of copyright years is collapsed into a range, this character is used to separate the first and last years.
See also copyright-collapse-yearsvariablecopyright-collapse-years and copyright-year-separatorvariablecopyright-year-separator.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When a series of copyright years (or year ranges) is formatted, this string is used to separate them.
See also copyright-year-range-separatorvariablecopyright-year-range-separator and copyright-collapse-yearsvariablecopyright-collapse-years.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Format strings for dates and dateTimes

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The most convenient format for storing dates that will be machine processed: sorted, indexed, etc, is . When publishing these dates, it’s often desirable to use a different format, one more familiar to readers.

A pubdate that conforms to an ISO 8601 date (“yyyy-mm-dd”) will be formatted with the date-date-formatparamdate-date-format; one that conforms to an ISO 8601 dateTime (“yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss”) will be formatted with the date-dateTime-formatparamdate-dateTime-format.
See also f:date-format.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this parameter is true, the head element of each result document will contain meta elements for Dublin Core metadata that can be derived from the source document.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The debugparamdebug parameter contains a space separated list of flags. Depending on which flags are enabled, various additional debugging messages will be emitted during processing.
The following flags are supported:

listitem.para: Display additional information about callout processing.
Display additional information about the computation of character alignment processing in CALS tables.
Display additional information about chunk cleanup processing.
Display additional information about chunk selection.
Display additional information about the DocBook 4.x to 5.x upgrade process.
Display additional information about dynamic profiling.
Display additional information about what elements are suppressed by dynamic profiling.
Display additional information about the results of the extracting properties from images. This will display all of the properties available from each image.
Display additional information about the resolution of intra-chunk references. to links.
Display additional information about intra-chunk references.
Display additional information about how media object URIs are constructed.
Display additional information about how media objects are selected.
Display additional information about the pipeline processing stages.
Display additional information about profiling.
Display additional information about what elements are suppressed by profiling.
Display additional information about the properties associated with a verbatim environment.
Display additional information about how verbatim environments are rendered.
Display additional information about how tables are rendered.
Display additional information about how title page templates are selected.
Display additional information about title page templates.
Display additional information about how verbatim elements are processed.
Display additional information about XLink resolution.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The floatstyle attribute on formal objects (figure, etc.) indicates that they should float. This is achieved by adding the float style as a class value in the HTML output. If the value of floatstyle is “float”, then the default-float-styleparamdefault-float-style will be applied. In other words, the CSS classes will be “float left” (as long as default-float-styleparamdefault-float-style is “left”). If any other value is given for floatstyle, then the CSS classes will be “float value”.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the stylesheets need to generate text (the names of labels such as “Chapter”, for example), they attempt to do so in the same language as the document. This is determined by finding the nearast in-scope xml:lang attribute from the context where the generated text is required.
If there is no in-scope xml:lang attribute, or if there is no localization available for the language specified, the default-languageparamdefault-language is used instead.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The magnitude and units of the default length

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the stylesheet encounters a length that it cannot parse, the default magnitude and unit are used for that length. See .

refnamediv.refpurpose: The default style for formatting personal names

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The stylesheets can format personal names in a variety of ways. Absent any indication of what style to use, the default-personal-name-styleparamdefault-personal-name-style will be used; see t:person-name.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If a default-themeparamdefault-theme is specified, its value will be added to the class attribute on the html element(s) generated. The actual theme implementation is performed in CSS. See theme-listvariabletheme-list for a list of themes. You can add your own themes with custom CSS (with m:html-head-links mode, for example).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Include division labels in component labels?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If true, component labels will be prefixed with the label of their containing division (part, reference, etc.) In other words, chapter 2 in part I will be labeled “I.2” if this is true and simply “2” if it’s false.
See also component-numbers-inheritparamcomponent-numbers-inherit, section-numbers-inheritparamsection-numbers-inherit, and v:title-propertiesvariablev:title-properties.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The docbook-transclusionparamdocbook-transclusion controls whether or not DocBook transclusion processing (see ) is performed. The default at present is false because I don’t believe it’s in widespread use and transclusion processing on large documents can be quite slow. If either of those conditions change, the default may become true in some future version of the stylesheets.

refnamediv.refpurpose: How are errors in dynamic profiling handled?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If an error occurs evaluating a dynamic profiling expression, what should happen? That depends on the setting of dynamic-profile-errorparamdynamic-profile-error:

listitem.para: The error is ignored. This has no effect on whether or not the element is included.
The error is ignored and the expression is considered to have returned a value of “true”.
The error is ignored and the expression is considered to have returned a value of “false”.
Raises the dbe:DYNAMIC-PROFILE-EVAL-ERROR exception.
Raises the dbe:INVALID-DYNAMIC-PROFILE-ERROR exception.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this parameter is true, dynamic profiling will be applied to the document. See .

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If experimental-pmujparamexperimental-pmuj is true, then links will be inserted from link targets back to link sources. In other words, if clicking on “A” jumps you to “B”, the stylesheets will add a link at “B” that jumps you back back to “A”. (Pmuj is jump spelled backwards.)

caution.para: This feature is entirely experimental. It may change in arbitrary ways or it may be abandoned.

refsection.para: Support is limited at the moment to inlines and formal objects that have title pages. There’s currently no where to insert markup for every possible element that could be a link target.
Pmuj’s from title pages should probably be inserted in the heading, not above it, just because the styling would be nicer.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: There are different styles of footnote numeration. This parameter contains a list of the symbols that should be used. If there could be more footnotes than symbols in the list, the last symbol in the list must be a character suitable for formatting numbers.

For example, if the sequence in footnote-numerationparamfootnote-numeration is “*”, “†”, “a”, then the first footnote will be marked with “*”, the second with “†”, the third with “a”, the forth with “b”, and so on.
When chunking, footnotes may be renumbered within each chunk (see chunk-renumber-footnotesparamchunk-renumber-footnotes).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specify placement of title on formal elements

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Formal elements are elements with a title that are often displayed with a caption: figure, table, example and equation. The formal-object-title-placementparamformal-object-title-placement parameter determines if the title precedes or follows the element itself.

The parameter consists of a series of tokens, “before”, “after”, or “element:position”. The named forms (e.g., figure:before) take precedence with the unnamed form serving as a default for any that don’t have named forms.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The funcsynopsis element can be rendered in several styles. The funcsynopsis-default-styleparamfuncsynopsis-default-style parameter determines which style is used by default.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Maximium width of a function synopsis

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When rendering funcsynopsis elements, the width of the synopsis depends on the number of parameters and the lengths of their names and types. If the width of the funcsynopsis would exceed funcsynopsis-table-thresholdparamfuncsynopsis-table-threshold characters, the presentation switches from an inline style to a tabular style. The tabular style aligns the parameters up vertically after the function name.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This punctuation character is added after the end of a funcsynopisis. The default value of “;” is appropriate for C and other languages that use “;” as statement separator.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate the HTML page structure around the styled document

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this parameter is true, then a complete HTML page will be generated for the transformed document: an html tag, head and body tags, etc. If it’s false, then only the “raw” transformed content will be produced. This is true for both the primary output and any secondary result documents.

note.para: When the “raw” output option is selected, links to the CSS stylesheets, scripts, and other interactive features will not be generated. You must make sure those are provided in some other way.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If a document contains an empty setindex, index, or indexdiv, and generate-indexparamgenerate-index is true, then an index will automatically be generated from any indexterms found in the document.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Determines if subsubections appear in the table of contents

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The generate-nested-tocparamgenerate-nested-toc parameter is an XPath expression. If it evaluates to true when the context item is an element that appears in the table of contents (ToC), then the immediate children of that element will may also occur in the ToC.

For example, if this expression returns true for a chapter element that appears in the ToC, then the first level sections in that chapter will also appear in the ToC. If the expression returns true for one of those sections, then the second level sections of the chapter will appear in the ToC, etc.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The generate-tocparamgenerate-toc parameter is an XPath expression. If the expression evaluates to true for any element, then a table of contents will be generated automatically at the beginning of that element.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the generate-trivial-tocparamgenerate-trivial-toc parameter is true, a table of contents will be generated even if it consists of only a single entry. Otherwise, such “trivial” tables of contents will be elided.

A trivial table of contents will always be generated if there are other lists of titles (for example, a list of figures). This parameter applies only to top-level tables of contents. Nested tables of contents will be generated even if they consist of only a single entry.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The string generated as the unique identifier for the root of the tree

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When f:generate-id is constructing a unique identifier for an element, it walks up the ancestors of that element. If it reaches the root of the tree, it uses generated-id-rootparamgenerated-id-root to mark that location.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The string generated to separate parts of a unique identifier

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When f:generate-id is constructing a unique identifier for an element, it walks up the ancestors of that element. To make the identifiers easier to read, and to disambiguate values, it places generated-id-sepparamgenerated-id-sep between each component that it uses.

note.para: Historically, a “.” was used as the separator. However, if JavaScript is going to be used to process the HTML documents that the stylesheet produces, that may be inconvenient. (Because selectors use “.” to separate element names from class values.)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this parameter is true, the head element of each result document will contain a meta element with the name generator that identifies the stylesheet and processor used to produce the result.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The language used for generated text (words “Chapter” and “Figure”, for example) usually depends on the language of the (section of) the document where they appear. If gentext-languageparamgentext-language is specified, that language will be used for all generated text, regardless of the context.

refnamediv.refpurpose: An external collection of glossary entries

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: It’s often convenient to share a common glossary across many documents. If glossary-collectionparamglossary-collection points to a glossary, the stylesheets will automatically populate glossary entries in the document being transformed.
To achieve this:

listitem.para: Create a shared glossary and store it somewhere. Make sure that each entry in your shared glossary has a unique xml:id value.
Run your transformation with glossary-collectionparamglossary-collection set to the URI of that document.
In the document you’re transforming, refer to the shared entries with completely empty glossentry elements that have the same xml:id as an entry in the shared glossary.

refsection.para: The stylesheets will copy those entries into your document before processing it.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If glossary-sort-entriesparamglossary-sort-entries is true, the entries in a glossary or glosslist will be sorted before transformation. This saves the author from the burden of maintaining the list in a strictly alphabetic order.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The extension used for HTML output when chunking

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When using chunking (see ), the resulting HTML documents will have this extension by default.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this parameter is true, all of the scaling attributes on images are ignored. Images will be displayed at their intrinsic size.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the extension functions necessary to determine the intrinsic height of an image are unavailable, or if the height cannot be determined, this value will be used as the assumed intrinsic height of the image.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the extension functions necessary to determine the intrinsic width of an image are unavailable, or if the width cannot be determined, this value will be used as the assumed intrinsic width of the image.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Warn if image properties cannot be obtained?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This flag controls whether or not an xsl:message is emitted when the ext:image-properties extension function is unavailable.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Make distinct indexes based on role and type?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: DocBook supports the creation of different types of index. A book that documents an API might have a general index, for example, and also an index of functions, an index of variables, etc.

Typed indexes are created by specifying the index type in the type or role attribute. If index-on-typeparamindex-on-type is true, then separate indexes will be generated based on type values. If index-on-roleparamindex-on-role is true, then separate indexes will be generated based on role values.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Make index entries visible in the text?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this value is non-empty, small markers will be left in the text where indexterm elements appear. This is probably not appropriate for final publication, but it can be a useful way to review the level of indexing.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate index entries grouped by section

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Before the introduction of this parameter, an automatically generated index contained only one index entry for any given section. If the indexed-section-groupsparamindexed-section-groups parameter is true, an index entry will be generated for every indexterm, with a span surrounding all of the entries for each section. This results in a more complete index while still preserving the ability to see in which sections the terms occur.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If true, a list of equations will be generated. By default, they are only generated for books and sets.
This is a pseudo-boolean parameter. It is considered true if it has the value '1’, ‘yes’, or ‘true’. Any other value is considered false.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If true, a list of examples will be generated. By default, they are only generated for books and sets.
This is a pseudo-boolean parameter. It is considered true if it has the value '1’, ‘yes’, or ‘true’. Any other value is considered false.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If true, a list of figures will be generated. By default, they are only generated for books and sets.
This is a pseudo-boolean parameter. It is considered true if it has the value '1’, ‘yes’, or ‘true’. Any other value is considered false.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If true, a list of procedures will be generated. By default, they are only generated for books and sets.
This is a pseudo-boolean parameter. It is considered true if it has the value '1’, ‘yes’, or ‘true’. Any other value is considered false.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If true, a list of tables will be generated. By default, they are only generated for books and sets.
This is a pseudo-boolean parameter. It is considered true if it has the value '1’, ‘yes’, or ‘true’. Any other value is considered false.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter allows you to specify a tranformation for local markup conventions. This book uses several non-DocBook tagging conventions as a typing convenience, <att> for <tag class="attribute">, for example. These can be translated back into proper DocBook markup by the local-conventionsparamlocal-conventions stylesheet. This stylesheet is run at the end of the t:preprocess step, just before validation (see relax-ng-grammarparamrelax-ng-grammar).
The example stylesheet from the test suite looks like this:
It transforms pseudo-DocBook elements “att” and “mode” into valid DocBook markup.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If your documents use MathML, this library will be included to support MathML rendering. is a popular choice.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The mediaobject-accessibilityvariablemediaobject-accessibility parameter determines how accessibility features are added to media objects (image, video, and audio elements).
The value of this parameter is a list of strings. If the list contains:

listitem.para: A summary attribute will be added if there is an alt element or a textobject containing a single phrase is available.
A details element will be added to the div that surrounds the image if there is a textobject containing anything other than a single phrase available.

refsection.para: The list may contain either or both values. If other values are present, they are ignored.
See .

example.title: An example of media object accessibility
example.programlisting: <mediaobject> <alt>This is a skeuomorphic “postage stamp” with the DocBook logo.</alt> <imageobject> <imagedata fileref="media/stamp400x256.png"/> </imageobject> <textobject> <para>This is a skeuomorphic image of a “postage stamp.” Centrally, it features the DocBook wood duck logo. the word “DocBook” appears on the left hand side, rotated 90° counter-clockwise. The DocBook tag line, “The Source for Documentation” is printed in the upper-right corner. </para> </textobject> </mediaobject>

refsection.para: One possible rendering of such an example:

mediaobject.alt: This is a skeuomorphic “postage stamp” with the DocBook logo.

textobject.para: This is a skeuomorphic image of a “postage stamp.” Centrally, it features the DocBook wood duck logo. the word “DocBook” appears on the left hand side, rotated 90° counter-clockwise. The DocBook tag line, “The Source for Documentation” is printed in the upper-right corner.

refsection.para: Inspection of the HTML will reveal that the summary attribute is present on the div that wraps the figure and a details element precedes the image. These may or may not be rendered by your user agent depending on its accessibility features and settings.
See also table-accessibilityvariabletable-accessibility.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The mediaobject element (and inlinemediaobject) can contain several, alternative objects. The mediaobject-exclude-extensionsparammediaobject-exclude-extensions parameter provides a way to exclude some of them.

One common use case is to provide two versions of each image, one as a bitmap, perhaps a PNGPNG image, and another as a vector, perhaps an EPSEPS image. Then mediaobject-exclude-extensionsparammediaobject-exclude-extensions can be used to exclude “.eps” images from the web format and “.png” images from the print (or paged media) format.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Base URI of images and other media in the XML sources

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Computing the correct URI for media objects (images, videos, audio files, etc.) is complicated. See . The mediaobject-input-base-uriparammediaobject-input-base-uri is used to compute the absolute base URI of input media objects.
If the “cwd” extension function is available, then the default value of this parameter is the current working directory. Otherwise, the default value is the empty string.

The current working directory is only likely to be a useful value for this parameter if you are running the processor in the same directory where your XML source files are stored. See v:mediaobject-input-base-urivariablev:mediaobject-input-base-uri.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Base URI of images and other media in the output

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Computing the correct URI for media objects (images, videos, audio files, etc.) is complicated. See . The mediaobject-output-base-uriparammediaobject-output-base-uri is used to compute the base URI of media objects in the output.
It defaults to the empty string. See v:mediaobject-output-base-urivariablev:mediaobject-output-base-uri.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: To calculate the width of the columns in some complex CALS tables, the stylesheets need to know the page width. The nominal-page-widthparamnominal-page-width is used for this value.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If a book (or other element) has several appendixes, they will be numbered, usually “A”, “B”, “C”, etc. If there is only a single appendix, it will be numbered if number-single-appendixparamnumber-single-appendix is true. Otherwise, it will be unnumbered.
This can be used to create the numbered title “Appendix” for a single appendix.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The olink-databasesparamolink-databases parameter is a comma separated list of URIs. Each URI should contain an olink target database.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The orderedlist-item-numerationparamorderedlist-item-numeration parameter controls the numeration style of nested orderedlist elements. Items in the top-level list will use the numeration style of the first character in orderedlist-item-numerationparamorderedlist-item-numeration, items in the second-level list will use the numeration style of the second character in the string, etc. If the list depth exceeds the number of characters in the orderedlist-item-numerationparamorderedlist-item-numeration, selection “wraps back around” to the first character.

In other words, if the string is “1ai”: list items at the first, fourth, seventh, tenth, etc. depth will have arabic numeration. List items at the second, fifth, eight, eleventh, etc. depth will have lowercase alpha numeration, etc.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Treat othername as a middle name

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If othername-in-middleparamothername-in-middle is true, then the first othername in a personname will be presented as the person’s “middle” name. See t:person-name.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The output-mediaparamoutput-media parameter identifies the intended output medium, screen or print. It can be used to make conditional transformations.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Is Oxygen change tracking markup rendered?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If oxy-markupparamoxy-markup is true, then the change tracking processing instructions that Oxygen inserts into the document will be transformed into elements marked with CSS classes for rendering in the output. See oxy-markup-cssparamoxy-markup-css.

Rendering Oxygen change markup can be specified on a document-by-document bases with a dbdb processing instruction processing instruction. If the oxy-markup db processing instruction oxy-markup pseudo-attribute pseudo-attribute is true, the markup will be rendered. This processing instruction must be in the info element of the document element.

refnamediv.refpurpose: CSS markup for Oxygen changebar markup

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If Oxygen change markup is rendered, this CSS file is added to the output for styling the added and deleted regions.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This value selects the page style. The page style is reflected in the class attribute on the root html element. It is then used by the CSS stylesheets. A page style of “value” will be added to the class attribute as “value-style”.
The CSS print stylesheets support two styles: article and book. The book style places new components on a right-hand page and adjusts the inner margin for binding.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This value selects the paper size. The paper size is reflected in the class attribute on the root html element. It is then used by the CSS stylesheets.
The CSS print stylesheets support three page sizes: A4, A5, and (US) Letter. Additional sizes can be implemented in CSS.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a persistent Table of Contents?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this value is true, then a copy of the Table of Contents (ToC) will be added to every file produced. This Table of Contents is read by JavaScript when displayed in the browser and provides a “popup” ToC on every page.

note.para: The Table of Contents is secreted away in a script element so that it will be ignored by screen readers and other user agents that don’t support JavaScript or CSS.

refsection.para: The persistent ToC popup is transient by default, meaning that it will disappear if you use it to navigate to a different page. If you open the popup by “shift-clicking” on it, the ToC will persist until you dismiss it.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the persistent ToC popup is enabled, a link to this CSS file will be added to the HTML HEAD.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Script to support the persistent ToC

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the persistent ToC is enabled, a link to this script will be added to the document. This script must contain the JavaScript necessary to support the persistent ToC feature.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a search box in the persistent ToC

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this value is true, then a search box is added to the top of the persistent Table of Contents (ToC). Any string typed into this search box will be used to filter the entries shown below it.

The filter is a case-insensitive regular expression match against the text of each line in the ToC where arbitrary characters may occur anywhere in the string. In other words, the text “cat” will generate the regular expression “c.*a.*t.*” for the purpose of searching.
This setting has no effect if persistent-tocparampersistent-toc is false.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The number of pixels per inch

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the stylesheets need to convert between absolute and relative units (see ), this value is used to convert lengths into pixels. If pixels-per-inchparampixels-per-inch has the value 96, then 25% of a 6in width is 144px.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The procedure-step-numerationparamprocedure-step-numeration parameter controls the numeration style of nested steps and substeps in a procedure. Steps at the top level will use the numeration style of the first character in procedure-step-numerationparamprocedure-step-numeration, substeps at the second-level will use the numeration style of the second character in the string, etc. If the step depth exceeds the number of characters in the procedure-step-numerationparamprocedure-step-numeration, selection “wraps back around” to the first character.

In other words, if the string is “1ai”: steps at the first, fourth, seventh, tenth, etc. depth will have arabic numeration. Steps at the second, fifth, eight, eleventh, etc. depth will have lowercase alpha numeration, etc.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A productionset consists of non-terminals on the “left hand side” (LHS) and the productions that they expand to on the “right hand side” (RHS). When formatted, this string will be used as the separator between the left- and right-hand sides.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The tokens (separated by profile-separatorparamprofile-separator) specified for profile-archparamprofile-arch are matched against the values in the arch attribute. See .

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The tokens (separated by profile-separatorparamprofile-separator) specified for profile-audienceparamprofile-audience are matched against the values in the audience attribute. See .

refsection.title: Description

refsection.para: When generating a Table of Contents, the section-toc-depthparamsection-toc-depth determines the maximum depth of section to include. See also generate-tocparamgenerate-toc and generate-nested-tocparamgenerate-nested-toc.

refnamediv.refpurpose: How are footnotes numbered in tables?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: There are different styles of footnote numeration. This parameter contains a list of the symbols that should be used to mark footnotes in tables. If there could be more footnotes than symbols in the list, the last symbol in the list must be a character suitable for formatting numbers. See footnote-numerationparamfootnote-numeration.
Footnote number begins with the first symbol in each table.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Create links to standard DocBook CSS stylesheets?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If this parameter is true, then the output will contain links to the standard DocBook CSS stylesheets:
refsection.programlisting: <link href="{$resource-base-uri}css/docbook.css" rel="stylesheet"/> <link href="{$resource-base-uri}css/docbook-screen.css" rel="stylesheet" media="screen"/> <link href="{$resource-base-uri}css/docbook-page-setup.css" rel="stylesheet" media="print"/> <link href="{$resource-base-uri}css/docbook-paged.css" rel="stylesheet" media="print"/>
refsection.para: You can quickly disable all of these links by setting this parameter to false. There are a number of other stylesheets that are only conditionally included, see verbatim-syntax-highlight-cssparamverbatim-syntax-highlight-css, persistent-toc-cssparampersistent-toc-css, and oxy-markup-cssparamoxy-markup-css. User defined stylesheets are added with user-css-linksparamuser-css-links.

refnamediv.refpurpose: A list of user-defined CSS stylesheets

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter is a space separated list of CSS stylesheets. Each will be added to the output after the standard stylesheets.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Threshold value for considering varlistentry terms “long”

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the sum of the lengths of the term elements in a varlistentry exceeds this threshold, the variable list will have a “long” class. This can be used in CSS or in other downstream processing to decide whether or not the terms and their corresponding list items should be aligned side-by-side.
The length computation is just the number of characters. No attempt is made to adjust for wide or narrow characters.

refnamediv.refpurpose: A list determining how callouts are processed

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The verbatim-calloutsparamverbatim-callouts parameter is a space separated list of token values. These token values determine which kinds of callouts in a programlistingco or screenco will be processed and how.

listitem.para: If “linecolumn” appears in the list then callouts that have a units attribute of linecolumn and specify both a line and column will be processed. A callout marker will be placed on the line and before the column indicated. Additional lines and columns will be added to the listing if necessary.

If “lines” appears in the list then callouts that have a units attribute of linecolumn and specify only a line will be processed. A callout marker will be placed on the line and before the callout-default-columnparamcallout-default-column.

If “lineranges-first” appears in the list then callouts that have a units attribute of linerange will be processed. A callout marker will be placed on the first line and before the callout-default-columnparamcallout-default-column.
Only one of lineranges-first and lineranges-all should be specified.

If “lineranges-first” appears in the list then callouts that have a units attribute of linerange will be processed. A callout marker will be placed on every line in the range before the callout-default-columnparamcallout-default-column.
Only one of lineranges-first and lineranges-all should be specified.

refsection.para: There is no support for areas with a units value of “calspair” or “linecolumnpair”. They are always ignored.

refnamediv.refpurpose: List of verbatim elements to be rendered in the line style

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter is a space-separated list of element names (local names). Verbatim elements that appear in this list will be formatted using the line style by default. For a discussion of verbatim elements and styles, see .

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When formatting verbatim environments with line numbers, environments less than verbatim-number-minlinesparamverbatim-number-minlines in length will not be numbered.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Verbatim environments that should be numbered

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter is a space-separated list of element names (local names). Verbatim elements that appear in this list will be formatted with line numbers. For a discussion of verbatim elements and styles, see .

refnamediv.refpurpose: List of verbatim elements to be rendered in the plain style

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter is a space-separated list of element names (local names). Verbatim elements that appear in this list will be formatted using the plain style by default. For a discussion of verbatim elements and styles, see .

refnamediv.refpurpose: The space character to use when padding verbatim lines

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: When a verbatim line has to be padded in order to get a callout to appear in the correct column, this character will be used as the padding character. For a discussion of verbatim elements and styles, see .

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The default verbatim style for verbatim environments that do not specify a style explicitly. For a discussion of verbatim elements and styles, see .

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If the verbatim-syntax-highlight-languagesparamverbatim-syntax-highlight-languages parameter is non-empty, then this stylesheet will be linked from the HTML document. The purpose of this stylesheet is to provide styling (fonts, colors, etc.) for syntax highlighted verbatim listings.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Languages for which syntax highlighting should be performed

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter is a space-separated list of programming languages. If the Pygments Pygments Syntax highlightingPygments syntax highlighter is available, the stylesheets can apply syntax highlighting to program listings. If the program listing language (as specified in the language attribute) appears in the list of verbatim-syntax-highlight-languagesparamverbatim-syntax-highlight-languages, syntax highlighting will be attempted.

note.para: Syntax highlighting is incompatible with inline markup in the program listing; the embedded markup will be ignored.

refsection.para: The examples in this guide show syntax highlighting applied to XML.
See also v:verbatim-syntax-highlight-optionsvariablev:verbatim-syntax-highlight-options and v:verbatim-syntax-highlight-pygments-optionsvariablev:verbatim-syntax-highlight-pygments-options.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter specifies the syntax highlighter to use. Most of the parameters related to syntax highlighting only work if the pygments highlighter is selected. However, that requires running an external process which might not be available and which, even if it is available, has an impact on performance. Using Pygments has the advantage that the stylesheets have more control over the process and it is available both for online and paged media formats.

The alternative to running an external program is to use JavaScript to highlight the listing in the browser. This is faster at formatting time, but limits syntax highlighting to those environments where JavaScript is available.
The following options are supported:

listitem.para: This is the default highlighter.

Uses the JavaScript library to perform syntax highlighting. The highlight-js-head-elementsvariablehighlight-js-head-elements variable determines what CSS stylesheets and JavaScript libraries are loaded for this option.

Uses the JavaScript library to perform syntax highlighting. The prism-js-head-elementsvariableprism-js-head-elements variable determines what CSS stylesheets and JavaScript libraries are loaded for this option.
Disables syntax highlighting but also suppresses messages about features that are not available because syntax highlighting is disabled.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Trim trailing blank lines off verbatim environments?

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Trailing blank lines can be introduced into verbatim environments in a number of ways. Transcluded text files may have trailing blank lines, for example, and authors often put a newline before the closing tag of an environment.

This can produce spurious looking listings in the documentation. If trailing newlines aren’t significant, setting verbatim-trim-trailing-blank-linesparamverbatim-trim-trailing-blank-lines will cause the stylesheets to trim blank (that is, entirely empty) lines from the end of verbatim environments.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Presentation style for XLink extended links

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para:
The stylesheets support XLink extended links. Extended links make it possible to have one-to-many links. That is, a single link such as
DocBook
may point to more than one target. Two styles are supported: “inline” which renders a link to each target inline after the originating link, and “javascript” which uses JavaScriptJavaScript to create a popup menu for the links.

The XLink style for a document applies to the entire document, you cannot specify inline presentation in some cases and JavaScript presentation in others. However, if you specify “document” as the value for xlink-styleparamxlink-style, then a dbdb processing instruction processing instruction in the document’s top-level info element can be used to control the presentation. Specify the style in the xlink-style db processing instruction xlink-style pseudo-attribute pseudo-attribute.
If the document style is selected and no processing instruction specifying a style exists, the xlink-style-defaultparamxlink-style-default style will be selected.

refsection.para: Specifies the default XLink style if “document” is specified for the xlink-styleparamxlink-style and no processing instruction specifying a style exists.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This parameter is only true if the stylesheets are running in the context of the XSpec test harness. This allows tests to be crafted such that normal variations (Saxon HE vs. EE, the version of the stylesheets, or the current time, for example) don’t introduce spurious differences in the results, causing tests to fail.

refsection.para: The bridgehead element allows the author to insert a heading without regard to the logical structure of the document. This variable controls how the values provided in the renderas attribute map to HTML. If there is no mapping for the specified rendering, it is rendered as a div.

refsection.para: When the chunk-includeparamchunk-include and chunk-excludeparamchunk-exclude expressions are evaluated, the namespace bindings in this variable will be in-scope.
